barker_notes.barker_summary: Regulations for immigrants [May? —, 1825]. (1) Report intentions and file character certificate on arrival. (2) Get permission to select land. (3) Arrange to pay certain fees, including $60 to the empresario for each league.
barker_notes.barker_footnotes: This is probably not a part of the preceding document, since it provides for a payment of $75 to the empresario instead of $60. The other fees conform, however, and it may have been a preliminary draft by Austin for the preceding document.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1106-1108

*div1 type="summary"* *p*Regulations for immigrants [May? —, 1825]. (1) Report intentions and file character certificate on arrival. (2) Get permission to select land. (3) Arrange to pay certain fees, including $60 to the empresario for each league.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*[May?—, 1825.]*/p*
*p*Regulations to be observed by *person_mentioned*persons who wish to settle in the *location_mentioned*Colony*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* which the *person_mentioned*Govt */person_mentioned*have authorised *person_mentioned*Stephen F Austin*/person_mentioned* to establish in *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*by Contract dated *date_mentioned n="04-27-1825">April [27] 1825 */date_mentioned*being the *location_mentioned*second Colony*/location_mentioned* of said *person_mentioned*Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Art 1st *person_mentioned*Every person wishing to become a settler */person_mentioned*must immediately after his arrival present himself to me and signify his desire to that effect and leave with me recommendations from the *person_mentioned*Authorities */person_mentioned*of the place where he moved from Accrediting his Cristianity morality and good habits which will be laid before the *person_mentioned*Commr */person_mentioned*as the Law requires—he will also deliver in writing a statement of his name, whether married or single, his *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*specifying their number and sexes, the *location_mentioned*place of his nativity*/location_mentioned*, his age, where from last, and his occupation as prescribed in the 3d article of the Colonisation Law, and he will at the same time take the oath prescribed by the 3d article of the instructions to the *person_mentioned*Commissioner */person_mentioned*to support the federal and state Constitution and the General and State Laws of his *location_mentioned*adopted Country*/location_mentioned*, his name will then be entered in the *location_mentioned*register book of the Colony*/location_mentioned* and from that time and not before he will be considered an *person_mentioned*applicant*/person_mentioned*, and as such entitled by Law to the priviledges granted to the *person_mentioned*Colonists*/person_mentioned*—the oath must be taken before the *person_mentioned*Commissioner */person_mentioned*or in his Absence before the *person_mentioned*Alcalde*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*Art 2d after Complying with the foregoing Article and receiving a permission in Writing from the *person_mentioned*Empresario */person_mentioned*to select *location_mentioned*Land */location_mentioned*as one of the *person_mentioned*Colonists */person_mentioned*he will proceed to make his selection on *location_mentioned*unappropriated Lands*/location_mentioned* and give notice at the *location_mentioned*office of the *person_mentioned*Empresario*/person_mentioned**/location_mentioned* of his selection Within 30 days after the date of his permission in order that an entry may be made of the same and instructions issued to the *person_mentioned*surveyors */person_mentioned*to survey it as the Law and their instructions require the *person_mentioned*applicant */person_mentioned*will also at this time present his petition to the *person_mentioned*Commissioner */person_mentioned*on stamp paper in due form and in Spanish.*/p*
*p*Art 3d On the presentation of the petition as stated in the foregoing article satisfactory arrangements must be made to the *person_mentioned*Commissioner */person_mentioned*for the payment of fifteen Dollars to him, and five dollars into the *location_mentioned*office to *person_mentioned*Mr Samuel M Williams*/person_mentioned**/location_mentioned* and on receipt of the title five dollars more being for his services in extending and copying the title, this is exclusive of stamp paper*/p*
*p*Art 4th The *person_mentioned*Empresario */person_mentioned*as the *person_mentioned*general Agent of the Colonists*/person_mentioned* has procured at his own expense and Labor, the priviledge of ennabling them to obtain Complete titles to land without the delay and expense and perplexities of personal applications at the *location_mentioned*seat of Govt*/location_mentioned* by each individual—he has all the Labor of the translations—the examination of the *person_mentioned*surveyors */person_mentioned*returns and translating them, the receiving, registering and locating of *person_mentioned*Colonists*/person_mentioned*, also heavy responsibilities and much Labor of a Complicated and perplexing Nature—and as his Whole time must necessarily be devoted to the service of the *person_mentioned*Colonists*/person_mentioned*, and under heavy expences, he in justice and equity has a right to expect a proper remuneration from them and the 9th article of the Colonisation Law gives him a legal right to exact it. his object is to receive from the *person_mentioned*settlers */person_mentioned*a small recompence in Comparison with the benefits he procures and the Labor he undergoes for them.*/p*
*p*Every *person_mentioned*settler */person_mentioned*therefore who applies for admission into my *location_mentioned*Colony*/location_mentioned* will be bound to pay me Sixty dollars, if he is entitled to *location_mentioned*a League and thirty*/location_mentioned* if only to a quarter of a League— Ten Dollars of which sum must be paid at the time of obtaining the permission spoken of in the Second article, Twenty Dollars in Six months after the date of said permission, and the balance Thirty Dollars in 18 months from the date of sd permission.— the payment of which must be secured by Note and lien on the Land granted.*/p*
*p*5th In future No respect or preference will be given to any *location_mentioned*settlement */location_mentioned*improvement or selection whatever made by any person Who shall not have Previously Complied with the foregoing regulations, (excepting however those who have at this time actually made improvements who are allowed until the *date_mentioned n="10-01-1825">first of October*/date_mentioned* to make application as required in the foregoing articles.*/p*
*p*The payments on a quarter of a League must be made as follows Ten Dollars on the receipt of the permission as aforementioned and the balance in 6 months thereafter*/p*.
*p*6th Should I be absent from this place *person_mentioned*Mr Samuel M Williams */person_mentioned*is authorised to receive applications and grant permissions as prescribed in the first and second articles of these regulations*/p*
*p*[Recapitulation]*/p*
*p*on making application to the *person_mentioned*Empr*/person_mentioned*__________________________ $10.*/p*
*p*on presentation of petition which must be within 30 days after application to the *person_mentioned*comr*/person_mentioned*___________________________________ 15.*/p*
*p*to be paid into the *location_mentioned*office */location_mentioned*at the same time____________________ 5.*/p*
*p*on receipt of title to be pd. into the *location_mentioned*office*/location_mentioned*______________________ 5.*/p*
*p*Stamp paper for original and copy__________________________ 2.*/p*
*p*Six months application to the *person_mentioned*Empro*/person_mentioned*_______________________ 20.*/p*
*p*one year after ditto to do__________________________________ 20.*/p*
*p*18 months after do to do________________________________________ 25.*/p*
*p*4 years after date of title to the *person_mentioned*Ayto*/person_mentioned*__________________________ 10*/p*.
*p*5 years after do to do_______________________________________ 10.*/p*
*p*6 years after do to do________________________________________ 10.*/p*
*p* 132.*/p*
*p*The above is exclusive of surveying fees which will be paid to the *person_mentioned*surveyors */person_mentioned*at the rate of 4 Dollars pr. mile.*/p*
*/div1*
